VLIB 3.2.1.0 Release Notes

March 19, 2015

VLIB Bundle Release Notes

Contents

  1. Introduction
  2. Getting Started
  3. Documentation
  4. What's New
  5. Upgrade and Compatibility Information
  6. Device Support
  7. Validation Information
  8. Known Issues
  9. Technical Support

Introduction

The VLIB bundle comprises the Texas Instruments Vision Library package together with the software tools (SWTOOLS) and all dependent packages in bundle format to simplify the release procedure.

Getting Started

The VLIB User's Manual provides the documentation and references necessary to integrate VLIB Library routines into a development platform.

Documentation

The following documentation is available:

User's Manual [HTML]
Test Report [HTML]
Software Manifest [HTML]
Release Notes Archive [LINK]

What's New

The following new features were added as compared to release 3.1:

  1. Local Binary Pattern
  2. Blob Analysis
  3. Performance Optimizations in following functions:
    1. VLIB_afast9_detectCorners
    2. VLIB_originalfast9_score
    3. VLIB_gauss5x5PyramidKernel_8
    4. VLIB_integralImage16
    5. VLIB_ORB_computeRBrief
    6. VLIB_ORB_computeOrientation
    7. VLIB_aFast_nonmaxSuppression

The following issues were resolved:

  1. API documentation improvements.
  2. Updated remaining tests to reflect accurate performance profile information and test robustness from multiple test vectors.
  3. Fixed several memory leaks found in the unit test files
  4. VLIB_nonMaxSuppress_NxN_S16: Fix bug where out-of-bounds writes were occuring before the beginning of the output pointer.
  5. VLIB_weightedHistogram_1D_U8: Fix bug when weight is not equal to 1.
  6. VLIB_gradientV5x5PyramidKernel_8: Fix bug when gradient sums are negative.
  7. VLIB_recursiveFilterVert1stOrderS16: Fix bug in natural c version when image is non-square (width != height).
  8. VLIB_recursiveFilterVert1stOrder and VLIB_recursiveFilterVert1stOrderS16: Fix bug natural c version for images with height larger than width
  9. VLIB_initVarWithConstS16: Fix bug with negative const values
  10. VLIB_updateUWRVarianceS16: Fix bug with random stimulus (absolute value result was sometimes negative)
  11. VLIB_recursiveFilterVert1stOrderS16: Fix overflow bug due to incorrect casting
  12. VLIB_nonMaxSuppress_U16/U32: Fix bug where features were being repeated in output list
  13. VLIB_xyGradients_Magnitude_Orientations: Fix bug restricting image sizes to < 2^16 pixels
  14. VLIB_Connected_Components_Labeling: Fix bugs related LOW_MEMORY_WARNING always being returned, and numCCs value too high (U & V blobs were 2 blobs instead of 1)
  15. VLIB_disparity_SAD_firstRow8: Change size of pScratch elements to 16bits, in order to accomodate accumulation of 8 bit values without overflow.
  16. VLIB_disparity_SAD_firstRow16 and VLIB_disparity_SAD16: Change size of pScratch, pCost, and pMinCost elements to 32bits, in order to accomodate accumulation of 16 bit values without overflow.
  17. VLIB_Canny_Edge_Detection: Fix bug when numStrongEdges == 0
  18. VLIB_Canny_Edge_Detection: Fix bug affecting images > 255 pixels wide in wrapper function
  19. VLIB_Canny_Edge_Detection: Fix multiple bugs in wrapper function affecting perforance and border conditions
  20. VLIB_hysteresisThresholding: Fix bug which produced output mismatch with natural c version
  21. VLIB_hysteresisThresholding: Modified kernel to have programmable pitch
  22. VLIB_mixtureOfGaussiansS16: Fix bug which produced output mismatch with natural c version

Upgrade and Compatibility Information

This version of VLIB is compatible with the last released version:

YES
NO X

Note:
  1. Package compatibility keys are independent of component release versions. For more information visit: Package Versioning and Compatibility

Device Support

This release supports the following device families:

  • C66 DSP (ELF, Little-Endian format)

Validation Information

This release was built and validated using the following tools:

  • XDC Tools version: 3.25.00.48
  • RTSC Packaging Standard version: 2.0
  • C6000 Code Generation Tools version: 7.4.2
  • Code Composer Studio version: V5.4
  • GNU make version: 3.81

Known Issues

  1. Profiling benchmark representation needs to be normalized to input parameters for a subset of functions
  2. Continue to reduce the MISRAC violations

Technical Support

Questions regarding the VLIB library should be directed to the Texas Instruments RTOS E2E Forum. Please include the text 'VLIB' in the title and add 'C66' and VLIB tags to your post.

Package Versioning and Compatibility

Compatibility Keys

Compatibility keys serve two primary purposes:

  1. Enable tooling to identify incompatibilities between components
  2. Convey a level of compatibility between different releases to set end user expectations.

Each compatibility key is composed of 4 comma-delimited numbers - represented here by the letters M, S, R and P [M,S,R,P]. The table below provides a descriptive reference for compatibility key intention.

Compatibility Key Reference
Key Meaning Description
1 (M=Major) Break in compatibility The package consumer is required to re-write the calling source code to use the package
2 (S=Source) Source compatibility The package consumer’s source code doesn't require change, but does require a recompile
3 (R=Radix) Introduction of new features Compatibility with previous interfaces is not broken. If libraries are provided by the package, an application must re-link with the new libraries, but is not required to recompile its source
4 (P=Patch) Bug fixes only If libraries are provided by the package, an application must re-link with the new libraries, but is not required to recompile its source.

Versioning

Each package version is composed of 4 period-delimited numbers - represented here by the letters M, m, p and b [M.m.p.b]. The table below provides a descriptive reference regarding package version numbering.

Package Version Reference
Digit Meaning Description
1 (M=Major) Major revision Incremented when the new version is substantially different from the previous For example, a new module added or an existing module's algorithm significantly altered.
2 (m=minor) Minor revision Incremented when the new version has changed but not in a major way. For example, some minor changes in the API or feature set.
3 (p=patch) Patch number Incremented for all other source code changes. This include any packaging support code.
4 (b=build) Build number Incremented for each release delivery to CM. Reset for any change to M, m or p
